s.text: The finest and most authentic work is mashrabiya, the lattice screens that covered Ottoman windows allowing women to watch the world go by without being seen.
Copper and brass: These metals have long been used for practical items such as water carriers, samovars, or cooking pots and they make excellent souvenirs.
With so many people trying to get away from it all, it is the perfect contrast to our urban existence.
This involves a morning or afternoon of theory and swimming pool work, which will give you the chance to try out the basic techniques.

The Aswan sound and light show takes place at Philae Temple some 20 minutes away.
Sound and Light Shows: All the most impressive ancient sites in Egypt have a sound and light show, and it adds an extra theatrical dimension to your Egypt experience.
For information on all Sound and Light shows Tel. (02) 386 3469; fax (02) 385 2880; web site <www.sound-light.egypt.com>.

However, the Egyptians are tenacious shopkeepers and you will have to have a will of steel and sense of humor to ignore their sales pitches.
